page.title: 19TRING'S OFFSPRING
page.content: AS PART OF THE DOMESDAY PROJECT,ALL THE FIRST YEARS TOOK PART IN A MUSICAL WRITTEN ESPECIALLY FOR THE EVENT BY OUR MUSIC TEACHER, MR. WATERFIELD. IT WAS CALLED "TRING'S OFFSPRING". THE STORY TOLD ABOUT LIFE IN ALTRINCHAM ALONG TIME AGO, AND HOW THERE WAS A BARRIER BETWEEN THE' POSH PEOPLE' AND THE 'ORDINARY PEOPLE'.IT SHOWED HOW AFTER OLD BUILDINGS WERE PULLED DOWN AND MODERN ONES WERE BUILT,PEOPLE BEGAN TO FORGET THEIR DIFFERENCES AND THE OLD BARRIER WAS ALSO PULLED DOWN. THERE WERE FIVE PARTS TO THE MUSICAL:- 1 DUNHAM WERE THE DESTROYERS, 1 LEIGH WERE THE POSH PEOPLE,1MASSEY WERE THE BUILDERS,1 STAMFORD WERE THE PLANNERS AND 1 TATTON WERE THE ORDINARY PEOPLE. AS WELL AS SINGING, WE ALSO ACTED. IT WAS HARD WORK AND WE HAD TO LEARN ALL THE WORDS IN ONE DAY,BUT WE ENJOYED IT
